intro: Acianthera costabilis, commonly known as the Costabilis Acianthera, is a species of orchid native to South America. It is characterized by its compact, terrestrial growth habit and produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pale pink. The plant typically blooms during the spring and early summer, and its roots are adapted to absorb moisture from the forest floor. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
